original: Essen, Erik Raguel (Arre), stadsarkitekt, Västervik, f. 17/5/86 i Julita, Södermani. 1., av komm :lantmät. o. godsäg. Raguel Vilhelm E. o. Ebba Ulrica Kristina von Post. G. 14 m. Ingrid Bratt. Barn: Ulla f. 15, g. 38 m. disp. Esbjörn Ulfsäter, Gertrud 19, Claes 21. — Stud:ex. i Nyköp. 05, avg:-ex. fr. KTH (A) 09, stud. v. KKH 09-12, Stud:res. t. Danm., Tyskl., Schweiz, Ital. o. Österr. 13-14. Prakt, arkit. i Sthlm 14-35, tjg. arkit. utom stat i byggn:styr. fr. 20, tf. stadsar-kit. i Gävle 32, stadsarkit. i Västervik o. Vimmerby samt i Hultsfreds o. Gamleby köp. sed. 35. Utf. arb. bl. a.: div. kyrkorestaurer., medarb. v. restaurer. av Schloss Hallwil i Schw^eiz, utf. chefsbost. i Ljusne, herrgård i Vambåsa, Blek., disp :bost. v. Sandviken, sjukh. v. Ljusne, priv:bost. o. div. restauranter. Led. av Sv. tekn:fören. sed. 08.
translated: Essen, Erik Raguel (Arre), city architect, Västervik, b. May 17, 1886 in Julita, Södermani. Son of county surveyor and landowner Raguel Vilhelm E. and Ebba Ulrica Kristina von Post. Married in 1914 to Ingrid Bratt. Children: Ulla b. 1915, married in 1938 to Esbjörn Ulfsäter, Gertrud b. 1919, Claes b. 1921. Completed high school in Nyköping in 1905, graduated from KTH (A) in 1909, studied at KKH from 1909-1912, and conducted study trips to Denmark, Germany, Switzerland, Italy, and Austria in 1913-1914. Practiced as an architect in Stockholm from 1914-1935, serving as a non-government architect in building management from 1920 and as temporary city architect in Gävle in 1932, then as city architect in Västervik and Vimmerby, as well as in Hultsfreds and Gamleby purchases since 1935. Completed works include various church restorations, contributed to the restoration of Schloss Hallwil in Switzerland, built a chief residence in Ljusne, a manor in Vambåsa, Blekinge, a dispensary apartment in Sandviken, a hospital in Ljusne, private residences, and various restaurants. Has been a member of the Swedish Technical Association since 1908.
